critique: This executive order focuses on promoting high labor standards and equitable workforce development on federally assisted projects. It encourages the use of project labor agreements, prevailing wages, and equal employment opportunity policies. It also establishes a task force to coordinate policy development and support the implementation of the order. The order does not address immigration directly. It could be seen as expanding executive power slightly through the creation of the task force and the direction to implementing agencies. It favors federal control by directing federal agencies to prioritize certain labor standards. It does not directly address national security or civil liberties. It promotes government intervention in the economy by encouraging high labor standards and equitable workforce development. It promotes social inclusion by prioritizing projects that promote and expand access to high-quality jobs for workers from underserved communities.
